question: 7 (b)
statement_html: Suppose p is an odd prime and let a be a primitive root mod p. Show that \(-a\) is a primitive root mod p if and only if \(p \equiv 1 \mod{4}\).
statement_latex:
Suppose \emph{p} is an odd prime and let \emph{a} be a primitive root
mod \emph{p}. Show that $-a$ is a primitive root mod \emph{p} if and
only if $p \equiv 1 \mod{4}$.
statement_raw: Suppose ''p'' is an odd prime and let ''a'' be a primitive root mod ''p''. Show that <math> -a</math> is a primitive root mod ''p'' if and only if <math> p \equiv 1 \mod{4} </math>.
